ray.rml

Interface Matrix<M extends Matrix<M,V>,V extends Vector<V>>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - The matrix type.
    V - The vector type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Addable<M>, Bufferable, Invertible<M>, Multiplicable<M>, Scalable<M,V>, Subtractable<M>, Transposable<M>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Matrix2, Matrix3, Matrix4
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Matrix2f, Matrix3f, Matrix4f

    interface Matrix<M extends Matrix<M,V>,V extends Vector<V>>
extends Addable<M>, Subtractable<M>, Multiplicable<M>, Invertible<M>, Transposable<M>, Scalable<M,V>, Bufferable
    A matrix is a rectangular structure to efficiently hold scalar values.

    This library's intent is for implementations to use column-major orderings and offers a #mult(Vector) method to allow post-multiplication with vectors, but not the other way around. In other words, for a vector v and matrix M, the column vectors v' can be calculated as v' = M * v, but not v' = v * M, which would require a row-vectors instead.

    You should make sure the dimensions of the matrix type match those of the vector type. For example, A 2x2 matrix should only be matched with a 2-component vector, a 3x3 matrix with a 3-component vector, and so on.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Detail

      • value

        float value(int row,
            int col)
        Returns the scalar value at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        row - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix row.
        col - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix column.
        Returns:
        The scalar value found at the specified location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either index is outside the row/column range for this matrix.

      • row

        V row(int row)
        Returns the specified matrix row as a new vector.
        Parameters:
        row - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix row.
        Returns:
        A vector with data from the specified row.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the row index is outside the range of rows for this matrix.

      • column

        V column(int col)
        Returns the specified matrix column as a new vector.
        Parameters:
        col - A zero-based index specifying the desired matrix column.
        Returns:
        A column-vector with data from the specified column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the column index is outside the range of columns for this matrix.

      • mult

        M mult(M m)
        Returns a new matrix with the product (i.e. concatenation) of this matrix multiplied by the specified matrix.
        Specified by:
        mult in interface Multiplicable<M extends Matrix<M,V>>
        Parameters:
        m - The matrix that will be concatenated to this matrix.
        Returns:
        A new instance with the product of this multiplication.

      • mult

        V mult(V v)
        Returns a new column-vector with the product (i.e. concatenation) of this matrix multiplied by the specified column-vector.
        Parameters:
        v - The vector that will be concatenated to this matrix.
        Returns:
        A new column-vector with the product of this multiplication.

      • mult

        M mult(float s)
        Returns a new matrix with the product (i.e. concatenation) of this matrix multiplied by the specified scalar value.
        Specified by:
        mult in interface Multiplicable<M extends Matrix<M,V>>
        Parameters:
        s - The scalar value that will be multiplied by each value in this matrix.
        Returns:
        A new matrix with the product of this multiplication.

      • determinant

        float determinant()
        Returns the determinant of this matrix.

        Note that if the determinant is zero, then this matrix is singular and cannot be inverted.

        Returns:
        The determinant of this matrix.
